How to enroll into any course
How can i enroll into a course
How do i enroll into a course
How can i register into a course
responses: You need department permission to enroll into any of any course. So, firstly add your desired courses into cart, then check for availability of your advisor and schedule an appointment. You can schedule an appointment with your advisor [here](https://umkc.starfishsolutions.com/starfish-ops/student/dashboard.html?tenantId=517)

patterns: course availability
Availability of any particular course
I would like to know the availability of a course
How can i find if a course is available
How can i find if a course has seats available
whom do i ask to check if there are seats in a class
responses: I can certainly help you with general information, but for detailed and up-to-date course availability, I recommend reaching out to our student advisor. They have access to the latest course schedules and enrollment details. You can contact them through [appointment](https://umkc.starfishsolutions.com/starfish-ops/student/dashboard.html?tenantId=517). If you have any other questions, feel free to ask!

Prerequisites for Computer Science and Data Science courses
What are the prerequisites for course?
What are the requirements for course?
Are there any essentials for enrolling in the course
What skills or prerequisites should one have before taking a course
Could you provide information on the must-haves for the course
What foundational knowledge is essential before starting a course on
responses: You can find prerequisites for all the courses in this [page](https://catalog.umkc.edu/course-offerings/graduate/comp-sci/)

patterns: What are the core subjects for computer science
Can you outline the key subjects that make up the core curriculum for ?
What are the fundamental courses included in the curriculum for computer science?
What core subjects are typically covered in a computer science?
What courses are considered essential for a
What is the required coursework for computer science
responses:
For Computer Science you have to complete any 3 core courses from the following
COMP-SCI 5520 Network Architecture
COMP-SCI 5531 Advanced Operating Systems
COMP-SCI 5551
Advanced Software Engineering
COMP-SCI 5565
Introduction to Statistical Learning
COMP-SCI 5592
Design and Analysis of Algorithms
For more information regarding other courses in computer science and electives related to computer science courses, you can [visit](https://catalog.umkc.edu/colleges-schools/science-engineering/computer-science/master-of-science-computer-science/)

patterns: What are the core subjects for data science
Can you outline the key subjects that make up the core curriculum for ?
What are the fundamental courses included in the curriculum for data science?
What core subjects are typically covered in a data science?
What courses are considered essential for a
What is the required coursework for data science
responses:
For Data Science you have to complete any 3 core courses from the following
COMP-SCI 5530 Principles of Data Science
COMP-SCI 5540 Principles of Big Data Management
COMP-SCI 5565
Introduction to Statistical Learning
COMP-SCI 5567 Deep Learning
COMP-SCI 5588 Data Science Capstone
For more information regarding other courses in computer science and electives related to data science courses, you can [visit](https://catalog.umkc.edu/colleges-schools/science-engineering/computer-science/master-of-science-data-science-analytics/)

patterns: Improvement in academics
Based on my current grades and performance, do you have any suggestions for improvement?
What resources do you recommend for improving performance in
Based on my grades, are there specific tutoring services you suggest for additional support
responses: UMKC Tutoring is a CRLA certified program that offers free one-on-one tutoring to UMKC students for many courses from a variety of subjects. Our peer tutors can help them understand important concepts, figure out the best way for them to study, and more! Our services are available by appointment or drop-ins. You can click the [link](https://www.umkc.edu/asm/umkc-tutoring/tutoring-faculty-staff-resources.html#:~:text=UMKC%20Tutoring%20is%20a%20CRLA,by%20appointment%20or%20drop%2Dins) to see our full course list.

patterns: What resources are available for academic and career counseling
Are there specific online platforms or portals for accessing academic support materials?
Can you recommend any online resources for resume building and job searching?
responses:
umkc provides a broad range of tools to assist you in all stages of your career development like:
->Academic and professional career path decisions
Resumes, cover letters, CVs and personal statements
Interview and networking preparation
Job and internship searches
Graduate and professional school applications
LinkedIn account review
Salary negotiation
Laptop Loaner Program
 you can find more information [here](https://www.umkc.edu/career-services/)

patterns: What are the counseling services available in the campus
Is there someone on campus I can speak to about personal issues or stress management?
Is there someone I can talk to about family emergencies or situations affecting my ability to focus on academics?
Can we discuss how the campus promotes inclusivity and addresses concerns related to diversity?
responses: UMKC Counseling Services provides a wide range of psychological services including counseling, psychological assessment and crisis intervention. There are group sessions, one on one consultation, medical referrals, you can book an appointment [here] (https://www.umkc.edu/wellness/services/counseling/index.html)

patterns: How do I include a course in my shopping cart?
What's the process for putting a course in the shopping cart?
Is there a way to include a course in the shopping cart?
Can you guide me on adding a course to the shopping cart?
responses:
Go to UMKC home page
Navigate to the footer
Click on the pathway
Login with your umkc student details
Click on manage classes
In the sidebar, under 'Enrollment' you can find 'Shopping Cart'
Select your semester and search for your classes based on your department
